full_text: 4-5 GEORGE VI. CHAP. 61. An Act for the relief of Ilona Klein, otherwise known as Eleanor Klein. [Assented to 14th June, 1941.] W HEREAS Ilona Klein, otherwise known as Eleanor Preamble. Klein, residing at the city of Montreal, in the province of Quebec, wife of Louis Klein, baker, who is domiciled in Canada and residing at the said city, has by her petition of October, A.D. 1928, at the said city, she then alleged that they were married on the twenty-first day she Ilona has Klein, prayed that, adultery by since petition being a spinster; and whereas her and adultery have been proved by evidence adduced and their marriage be dissolved; and whereas the said marriage because of his then, it is expedient that the prayer of her petition be granted: Therefore His Majesty, by and with the advice and consent follows:- of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as 1. The said marriage between Ilona Klein and Louis Marriage Klein, her husband, is hereby dissolved, and shall be hence- dissolved. forth null and void to all intents and purposes whatsoever. 2. The said Ilona Klein may at any time hereafter Right to marry any man whom she might lawfully marry if the said marry again. marriage with the said Louis Klein had not been solemnized. OTTAWA: Printed by EDMOND CLOUTISM, Law Printer to the King's Most Excellent Majesty. J. mash C.S.and C. P's. 51
